topic_overview.title: Binary Search Tree (BST)
topic_overview.description: A Binary Search Tree is a data structure where each node has at most two children (left and right). It's a tree-like structure where each node represents a value, and the left child node has a value less than its parent node, while the right child node has a value greater than its parent node. This structure allows for efficient searching, insertion, and deletion of nodes.
topic_overview.importance: BSTs are commonly used in databases, file systems, and other applications where data needs to be efficiently searched, sorted, and updated. They're also a fundamental data structure in computer science, and understanding BSTs is essential for advancing in programming and software development.
topic_overview.common_usage: BSTs are used in various areas, including database indexing, file system organization, and algorithm design. They're also used in many programming languages and frameworks, making them a crucial concept to grasp for software developers and programmers.

topics_covered_summary.insertion: Learn how to insert nodes into a Binary Search Tree, maintaining the tree's properties and ensuring efficient search and deletion operations.
topics_covered_summary.deletion: Discover how to delete nodes from a Binary Search Tree, handling various scenarios and edge cases to maintain the tree's integrity.
topics_covered_summary.search: Understand how to search for nodes in a Binary Search Tree, using efficient algorithms and techniques to find the desired node quickly.
topics_covered_summary.lca: Learn about the Lowest Common Ancestor (LCA) problem, finding the closest common node between two Binary Search Trees.
topics_covered_summary.maximum_sum_bst: Explore the concept of the maximum sum Binary Search Tree, finding the tree with the maximum sum of node values.
topics_covered_summary.problems_and_solutions: Get practice with a range of Binary Search Tree problems, including interview-style questions and coding challenges.
